title: (x) Help identifying a couple of fonts - Splendid Script, ParmaPetit {self (Justin), Akira}
content:
Hey all, I'm designing a website for a couple getting married and they want it to match their invitation - any ideas what these are?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017033131im_/http:/typophile.com/files/whatfont_5994.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017033131im_/http:/typophile.com/files/whatfont1_6705.jpg)

Thanks.
author: samurai

comments.content:
The serif sample is too small, and has too few key letters for me to use my Serif Guide effectively. Can you provide a larger sample and/or more letters? The twelve letters I need most are a,b,e,g,y and E,J,K,M,R,U,W.

The script should be in [Part 1 of my Script Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017033131/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/Script01Pg1.html).

Thanks,  
- Mike Yanega

Awesome script resource Mike. Here is another couple of examples, although it appears the script is Splendid Ornamenty.. still not sure about the first one though.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017033131im_/http:/typophile.com/files/whatthefont_4934.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017033131im_/http:/typophile.com/files/whatthefont1_4354.jpg)

Yes, the script font is [Splendid Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017033131/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/splendid-quartett/script/) from Storm Type. And the serif font is [ParmaPetit](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017033131/http:/www.dafont.com/parmapetit.font).

Yes, good Akira. Those other letters would have reminded me of Parma Petit. I knew there was something familiar about the f, and that was one of the early fonts I bought back in the 90's before Manfred made his fonts free.

- Mike Yanega
